message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.HC. 

The paper proposes algorithms for reducing the calibration effort required for brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) using event-related potentials (ERPs) in EEG signals. This involves adapting the classifier to individual subjects, which is a common problem in machine learning. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves adapting the classifier to different EEG headsets and reducing computational cost, which suggests it may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-categories.
